definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Avec ce travail, je ne manqu'rai pas d'argent. With this job, I won't lack money.
sentences.chinese: 有了这份工作，我就不缺钱了。

sentences.english: Lack of money inclines many young people towards crime.
sentences.chinese: 缺钱使很多年轻人产生了犯罪倾向。

sentences.english: In fact, Jason was short of money at that moment.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，那阵子詹森也正缺钱呢。

sentences.english: Kaz: OK Li. Why are we always short of money?
sentences.chinese: 好，为什么我们经常缺钱呢？

sentences.english: That way, only the über-nerds and the cash-poor/time-rich classes will bother to copy instead of buy.
sentences.chinese: 这样，只有缺钱时间又多的人才会购买盗版。

sentences.english: When money was scarce they simply bartered.
sentences.chinese: 当他们缺钱时就简单地以货易货。

sentences.english: He became Lord Mayor of London, and lent large sums of money to the king.
sentences.chinese: 他后来当上了伦敦市长，连国王缺钱花时都要向他借。

sentences.english: I can spare you a loan, bud , if you're short on cash.
sentences.chinese: 老弟，要是你缺钱的话，我可以借给你。

sentences.english: Perhaps North Korea, desperate for cash, is really interested.
sentences.chinese: 也许真的缺钱，朝鲜对这个计划表现出十足的兴趣。

sentences.english: The children in the remote areas in China can not go to school from want of money.
sentences.chinese: 中国偏远地区的孩子因缺钱而上不起学。

sentences.english: I needed some money, SO I hocked it last week.
sentences.chinese: 我缺钱用，所以上星期把它当了。

sentences.english: The plan fizzled out for lack of money.
sentences.chinese: 计划由于缺钱最终告吹。

sentences.english: Because it's always out of cash and always in debt.
sentences.chinese: 因为它总是缺钱花，又总是债务缠身。

sentences.english: The critical standard for estimating and evaluating securites market efficientcy is to see whether…
sentences.chinese: 中国证券市场不缺钱，缺的是合理的制度和机制。

sentences.english: Though (they are) lacking money, his parents managed to send him to university…
sentences.chinese: 尽管他的父母缺钱，仍设法送他上大学。

sentences.english: Pass to see also a lack of money, for he answered an AD, ten thousand yuan.
sentences.chinese: 关海看亦名缺钱，替他接了一个广告，一万元。

definition: variant of 佣錢|佣钱[yong4 qian5]
to bewail one's poverty/to complain about being hard up/to pretend to be poor
hard pressed for money/in financial straits
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
to have a cash flow problem
